Description: Are you looking for a Stellar Software solution to be a part of? Stellar Software provides innovative Marina Management software solutions to marinas across the United States and around the world. We recently secured funding to expand and are currently looking for skilled developers to help us take over the world and someday, the moon. Anyone in this role will be the envy of all their friends as they focus on top secret projects to serve a rapidly growing market. Our goal is to provide modern revenue producing software solutions to the marina industry. What Are We Looking For? We are seeking Front-end Developers with 2+ years of professional experience. MUST BE AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN THE U.S. (WE DO NOT SPONSOR). Our Website: https://boatrentalmanagement.com/ Job Type: Full-time Pay: $70,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year Schedule:  8 hour shift  COVID-19 considerations:This is a fully remote role. JobTitle: Senior React Frontend Developer (100% Remote, US Citizens On...
Description: We are looking for a Senior React Front-end Developer for our federal government client. Responsibilities:   Responsible for developing client-facing web applications. Participate in system design and collaborate with team in the full lifecycle from concept to production. Be the primary developer and own the development for the entire front-end application.  Requirements:   US Citizens only because the work is for a federal government client. Minimum 6 years of software development experience with 3 years of building web applications using React. Able to create re-usable components from the designs provided. Experience with Hooks and Context API is preferred. Strong Knowledge of JavaScript frameworks, Libraries, HTML, CSS frameworks such as BootStrap, Tailwind CSS. Experience with connecting React front-end UI with RESTful Web Services. Strong ability to work independently. Strong communication skills with a track record of working with and collaborating with teams. 4 Year College Degree; Computer Science or related discipline or equivalent experience.  What will we offer?  Above market pay. 100% remote and can work anywhere in the US. Opportunity to work in a very collaborative, respectful team.  Selection Process:   First Meeting: Meeting to explain more about the job, answer any questions you have, discuss the salary requirements. Second Meeting: Detailed technical discussion with current team members. After the second meeting, you should be willing to work for 2 weeks as a contractor at a convenient time for you (evenings, weekends) (paid at $80 per hour for the 2 weeks). After the 2 weeks, if we all see this is a good fit, we will offer you a full-time role.  Job Type: Full-time Pay: $100.00 - $120.00 per hour Schedule:  Monday to Friday  Application Question(s):  We can only consider US Citizens for this position. Are you a US Citizen? By submitting the application, you claim you are a US Citizen. If you are not a US Citizen, we will report you to USCIS for false claims. Do you agree? We explained the Selection Process in the job description. Please confirm you are willing to work with us for 2-weeks (paid at $80 per hour on 1099 for the 2 weeks). If offered the Full-time role, you should not be taking up other coding freelancing projects or working on similar projects. We are looking for someone who is focused. Do you agree to this? What is your expected hourly rate on W-2? We can also offer Corp-to-Corp contract provided you own your company.  Experience:  React: 4 years (Required)  Work Location: Remote

Web3 Frontend Developer About MegaFans:  MegaFans is a skilled gaming tournament program for mobile games. We work with many top game developers to integrate our reward SDK into their games to generate an exciting new competitive edge as well as a brand-new revenue stream. We offer competitive compensation packages, fun working environment, rapid career advancement, flexible hours, and operate on a hive management structure that rewards creativity and values transparency. So if you love collaborating, innovating, and pushing yourself to excellence, let's talk! More reasons to come work with us: We are remote, but based in beautiful British Columbia Canada and Southern California. About the position:  MegaFans are looking for a Senior Front End Developer who has deep experience in creating smart contracts for Crypto and NFT Projects, along with uber design skills to make our projects pop! We are about to launch our IDO and have some very exciting projects coming up. What you’ll do:   Implement full fledged and performant UI for our Web3 platform Build and maintain multiple React frontend Integrate interaction with blockchain into React frontend app to support functionality of several smart contracts. This includes, submitting transactions, updating user’s balances and other values, updating the state of submitted transactions in the state management tool and more. Build reusable cross-chain libraries Integrate your own UI/UX improvements to incentivize the users to use the platform. Create trustworthy user experiences by building interfaces that are simple, easy to comprehend, performant and reliable Discuss and adapt designs with the design team Continually learn and apply relevant software development practices, patterns, tools and technologies. Familiarity with fast iteration to produce working prototypes for demonstration purposes even if they are not hooked into a backend Comfortable with rapid directional changes of focus in a fast growing startup environment  What you’ll need:   Experience working in blockchain integration. Understand the flow of the web3 application. Understand how to interact with solidity contracts- Call functions, get properties, check status of the submitted transactions. Advanced knowledge of frontend state management using React Knowledge of Rest API and JSON Understand the flow of the assets from the smart contracts’ perspective. Self-motivated with a high level of autonomy. Excellent communication skills as our entire team is remote. Understand the interaction between frontend and solidity contracts.  What you will get:   The opportunity to join the leading competitive mobile platform in one of the fastest growing industries - Web3 gaming Work remotely Flexible live-work schedule International environment offering daily contact with team members from other countries & cultures  Job Type: Contract Salary: $75,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year Schedule:  8 hour shift  Supplemental Pay:  Bonus pay  Work Location: Remote

Frontend Software Engineer Team: Product & Engineering   Tilt (check us out here) is looking for a Frontend Software Engineer to join our team and tackle design and engineering challenges in the pursuit of great product experience for our customers.  Who are we?  Our product aims to do one thing: make leave not suck. We’re building a simple leave platform for People Teams to support leaves (e.g., new kid, car accident, mental illness, etc.). Most everyone goes on leave. Most everyone hates the leave process. Tilt is fixing that.  We’re committed to iterating towards elegant (and often elusive) solutions to complex problems, whether we’re crafting a workflow system to manage various leaves, modeling a classifier to predict class labels, building a modern API to support partners, or computing complex leave pay.  There’s only one way for us to succeed: solve hard problems with the robustness of a big organization, but with the speed and agility of a small, collaborative group. Doing that requires a lot of autonomy, and everyone here is responsible for a substantial part of Tilt’s future. Each one of us is expected to step up to the plate and deliver on aggressive goals. And everyone shares enormous respect for each other and the hard work that goes into making an insanely great product.  Who are you?  You are a Frontend Engineer that will help us build out the interface and experience of our customer-facing products and internal tools. You will design and develop new features and strengthen our existing architecture – including our component library to help us develop a consistent experience across our product. You will partner closely with members of our design team, helping to balance between launch timelines and product perfections.  Day-to-day, you will get your hands dirty by:  Actively participating throughout the product life cycle - from idea generation, design, prototyping to execution and shipping.  Collaborating closely with designers, product managers, and backend engineers to shape and build powerful data-backed applications.  Staying up-to-date with current frontend trends, identify community best practices, and teach others around you through code reviews and demo day.  Being a steward of privacy by design and software quality principles.  You’re a great fit if:  You have 5+ years of experience building and maintaining production software in a frontend focused or generalist role  You have experience optimizing React in production systems for performance and developer experience.  You are familiar with using a state management system such as Redux / MobX  You are someone who can own and drive technical decisions with a grounding in solving problems for our customers and business.  You have working knowledge of backend services and APIs.  Our Virtues:  HEALTH & FAMILY FIRST.  AUTONOMY PLUS TEAM. ALWAYS.  BE CURIOUS.  LOVE OUR CUSTOMERS.  FEARLESSLY FLEXIBLE.  Compensation:  This position is a full-time role reporting to the Engineering Lead with an annual salary of $120,000-$160,000USD plus stock options, because we believe everyone should have some stake in our business. We are people-first (this ain’t some PR jazz, we truly give a damn about our peeps) so in addition to a robust suite of ancillary benefits, we offer comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits for all employees with fully paid premiums. You must be authorized to work in the US.  Flexibility:  We are a fully remote company. We are committed to being fearlessly flexible and ensuring that all employees are set up and have the autonomy to do their best work, as well as have the balance to care for their health, family and life outside of work. Overall, we trust our team and are focused on outcomes not outputs.  Equal Opportunity Employer:  We celebrate and support our differences. We believe in the power of equality which is why we are an equal opportunity employer. Employment at Tilt is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications related to their professional competence. Tilt does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, creed, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by law. We comply with all applicable national, state, and local laws pertaining to nondiscrimination and equal opportunity.
